Energy Scale Calibration

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/energy.R
energy.Rd

Calibrates the energy scale of a gamma spectrum.

calibrate_energy(object, lines, ...)

is_calibrated(object)

# S4 method for GammaSpectrum,list
calibrate_energy(object, lines, ...)

# S4 method for GammaSpectrum,PeakPosition
calibrate_energy(object, lines, ...)

# S4 method for GammaSpectrum
is_calibrated(object)

# S4 method for GammaSpectra
is_calibrated(object)

Arguments

object

A GammaSpectrum or GammaSpectra object.
lines

A PeakPosition object or a list of length two. If a list is provided, each element must be a named numeric vector giving the observed peak position ("chanel") and the corresponding expected "energy" value (in keV).
...

Currently not used.

Value

calibrate_energy returns a GammaSpectrum object.

is_calibrated returns a logical vector.

Examples

## Import a CNF file
spc_file <- system.file("extdata/LaBr.TKA", package = "gamma")
(spc <- read(spc_file))
#> Gamma spectrum:
#> *  name: LaBr
#> *  date: 2020-05-24 11:48:20
#> *  live_time: 3385.54
#> *  real_time: 3403.67
#> *  chanels: 1024
#> *  energy_min: NA
#> *  energy_max: NA

## Set peak positions (chanel) and expected energy values
calib_lines <- list(
  chanel = c(86, 495, 879),
  energy = c(238, 1461, 2615)
)

## Adjust the energy scale
(spc1 <- calibrate_energy(spc, lines = calib_lines))
#> Gamma spectrum:
#> *  name: LaBr
#> *  date: 2020-05-24 11:48:20
#> *  live_time: 3385.54
#> *  real_time: 3403.67
#> *  chanels: 1024
#> *  energy_min: -15.38
#> *  energy_max: 3052.2

## Inspect results
plot(spc1, xaxis = "energy", yaxis = "count") +
  ggplot2::geom_vline(xintercept = c(238, 1461, 2614.5), linetype = 3)
